label: GUT Unification Scale
mathematical_goal: Derive the Grand Unification scale M_GUT = 2.1×10^16 GeV from G₂ topological invariants χ_eff = 144 and b₃ = 24
theoretical_significance: The GUT scale emerges purely from topology, not from gauge coupling running. This geometric value M_GUT ~ 2×10^16 GeV differs from the RG-running value ~6×10^15 GeV, suggesting intermediate threshold physics. The flux quantization condition χ_eff = 6*N_flux with N_flux = 24 directly determines the compactification scale through modular invariance. This resolves the gauge hierarchy problem geometrically: M_GUT/M_Planck ~ exp(-2π√6) ~ 10^-2.3.

experimental_comparison.interpretation: Higher geometric scale extends proton lifetime, consistent with Super-K bounds > 10^34 years
